data.title: Absolutly stunning church
data.text: Always make it a point to check out old churches during our travels. Saint Joseph Cathedral is an older Catholic Church from  about 1864. Incredible architecture amazing stain glass and priceless statues. Stroll the grounds check out the original chapel, the library out back has incredible hand painted ceiling. I am always amazed how wonderful these churches are . Free but make a donation if you can

data.title: Very beautiful
data.text: So very beautiful! Stopped in just for a quick looked. The gentleman who was in there turned on the lights so we could get pictures! The side street had a pay meter 25 cents for 30 minutes. Just long enough to see this Cathedral!

data.title: Gorgeous Church, Full of Traditional Catholic Values
data.text: You will want to lock your car and take your valuables, but the church is Gorgeous and Traditional. The Pastor is wonderful, Usher Sonny is a joy, and the congregation is diverse, but friendly. The church is recently updated with Stations of the Cross and a new altar; walls are freshly painted. Ceiling needs some repair. The Mass is traditional and welcomes participation with hymnals and missals readily available. There is a large entry where parents allow little ones a bit more freedom than inside where they can be disruptive. If you are lucky, Bishop Peter Libasci will be celebrating the mass with you! Very welcoming!

data.title: Highlight of Manchester
data.text: The Cathedral for the Catholic Diocese in the greater Manchester area. Church has recently been renovated, so beautiful!

data.title: Weekday Morning Mass
data.text: Like most churches in the States, weekday mass is celebrated in a chapel, not in the main church. But the chapel of this cathedral is larger than the usual and we were surprised that it was more than half full for the morning service. A good sign for the Catholic faithful of Manchester. The only challenge is finding street parking which is no metered.

data.title: Visit our beautiful church
data.text:
This is the most beautiful ornate cathedral in the center of Manchester NH with outstanding paintings & very large interior.
Visiting will certainly please you.

data.title: Beautiful church in the downtown area.
data.text: Visited the cathedral twice during the Easter season. Beautiful decor and history through out. Sunday mass makes you feel welcomed.

data.title: Nice New Hampshire Church
data.text: I brought my son to visit Manchester as part of his orientation prior to boarding school.  We passed by this beautiful local catholic church.  A place of love, fellowship and solitude.  We've been to 70+ countries and had seen great churches in the Vatican, Spain, France, Portugal, Austria, etc.  So this is obviously minute.  Nonetheless it was a great experience to visit a local church. Her architecture is influenced by New England culture and ideas.

data.title: The Children's Mass
data.text:
We have been members of St. Joseph's parish for 45 years. We always go to the 8:30 AM Sunday Mass. If you like a quiet time avoid this service. St. Joe's Masses are sung. They have excellent cantors and an organist and the attendees participate. Don't be afraid to come, we welcome all visitors. You may need a tutorial on the book used for the order of the mass, it's complicated. You also may be distracted by the kids. There is usually some babbling, crying or other sounds. We have to smile at the cuties and refocus on why we are really here.  
 Ok, not for you? The 10:30 Mass has a choir, too. There is a guided tour every first Sunday of the month. See our newly-acquired reredos (fancy altar) and stations of the cross. We also have a chapel which is open on weekdays. 
Warning: This downtown area is safe but don't keep goods exposed in your car and lock the door. 
To see a full schedule visit stjosephcathedralnh.org.

data.title: A part of History
data.text: Always enjoy going to the many services at the cathedral.   Large stain glass windows - marble  - wood finishes surround the inside of this grand church.

data.title: Proud of our Cathedral
data.text: A beautiful and welcoming Catholic Church. Located very near to the main branch of the Manchester library if you're there during the week.

data.title: Good place for prayer and meditation.
data.text: The small chapel is open for prayer and meditation.  This is our favorite place to stop in for prayer while in Manchester.

data.title: Time in the city, stop by-1st Sunday of the month tours
data.text: This is the cathedral for the diocese of Manchester (the Catholic Diocese encompassing the entire state of New Hampshire and all parishes therein.   The Cathedral underwent a partial renovation over the past 2 year including addition of a rederos to replace the one destroyed earlier.  Also, much painting, detail and plaster work was done to renovate the alter area following a massive restoration of the chapel.   The first Sunday of each month sees a tour with the diocesan historian (1pm) and it includes the crypts-well worth the wait for this treasure that features stained glass windows from Tirol!

data.title: hermosos
data.text: hermoso, es un lugar para visitar en familia y poder disfrutar de este placentero y delicado lugar de paz
